title: (x) Help.... can someone Identify this Script Font? / AB initials - Annabelle, Jeffriana {Mike Y, Jason Walcott}
content:
see attached...  
can anyone help identify what font was used for the AB-- I need to match and recreate this and add some matching type.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020051639im_/http:/typophile.com/files/rgb_5953.logo22.jpg)
author: jb4home

comments.content:
Help.... can someone Identify this Script Font?

see attached...  
can anyone help identify what font was used for the AB-- I need to match and recreate this and add some matching type.

Your image is in CMYK. I uploaded your image in RGB.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020051639im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ab_6551_5183.logo22.jpg)

thanks....  
my browser reads either - so I didn't realize...

Any help with the Font?

tks  
jb

As long as Mike is not online:  
 [http://www.bowfinprintworks.com/ScriptIDGuide.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020051639/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/ScriptIDGuide.html "http://www.bowfinprintworks.com/ScriptIDGuide.html")

I got this question as an e-mail and said I wasn't sure if it was a font. I looked through Part 1 of my Guide and think it may be a modification of Jukebox's [Annabelle](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020051639/http:/search.veer.com/Annabelle?producttype=TYP&category=Type). At least the A seems right and the B is similar. Perhaps the B was redrawn to be simpler?

- Mike Yanega

Interesting, I had the same feeling - the A looked familiar while the B looked kinda DIY :-) ... more like a "German double s" "ß". Maybe it's as simple as that. Unfortunately the test drive at veer.com only renders basic Latin chars.  
Andreas

I thought maybe the B was 'simplified' from Annabelle. Andreas, did you check the character map at Veer?

- Mike Yanega

It don't seem a ß either:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/jukebox/annabelle-jf/annabelle-jf/character...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020051639/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/jukebox/annabelle-jf/annabelle-jf/characters.html "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/jukebox/annabelle-jf/annabelle-jf/characters.html")

Time for me to weigh in here... The "A" is indeed from Annabelle. The "B" is the capital B from my 'Jeffriana' font. Both letters are unaltered and appear here as they do in the fonts. Glad I could clear this up. :)
